titles: England's black tribunall set forth in the triall of K. Charles I at a High Court of Justice at Westminster-Hall : together with his last speech when he was put to death on the scaffold, January 30, 1648 [i.e. 1649] : to which is added several dying speeches and manner of the putting to death of Earl of Strafford, Arch-Bishop of Canterbury, Duke Hamilton ...
notes: The second part has special t.p. and separate paging.
The first part has running title: The Tryal of King Charles the I.
Reproduction of original in the Huntington Library.
